## HSL.saturate() method

Increase the color saturation.

Can either be a number or a string which represents a percentage.

NOTE: the number is treated as a percentage value (not a ratio). - `50` is treated as `50%` - `0.5` is treated as `0.5%`

```ts
const hsl = HSL.create('hsl(180, 50%, 50%)')
hsl.saturate(50).s // => 75
hsl.saturate('100%').s // => 100

```

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
saturate(percent: number | string): HSL;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  percent | <code>number &#124; string</code> |  |

<b>Returns:</b>

`HSL`
